citation.article-title: Pseudolabrys taiwanensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an alphaproteobacterium isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pseudolabrys (Pseu.do.la′brys. Gr. adj. pseudes false; N.L. masc. n. Labrys a bacterial genus name; N.L. masc. n. Pseudolabrys the false Labrys).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-motile and short rod-shaped.
Reproduction of cells is by division and not by budding.
Methanol, methylamine, formaldehyde and formamide are not used as sole sources of carbon.
Growth occurs after 96 h incubation on TSA and NA at 30 °C.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c and C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
The DNA G+C content is 67 mol%.
The type species is Pseudolabrys taiwanensis.
